quotes.message: Real nobility is based on scorn, courage, and profound indifference.
quotes.name: Albert Camus

quotes.message: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: Nobility of spirit has more to do with simplicity than ostentation, wisdom rather than wealth, commitment rather than ambition.
quotes.name: Riccardo Muti

quotes.message: The nobility of a human being is strictly independent of that of his convictions.
quotes.name: Jean Rostand

quotes.message: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
quotes.name: Solon

quotes.message: It matters not from what stock we are descended so long as we have virtue; for that alone is true Nobility.
quotes.name: Wellins Calcott

quotes.message: Noble persons have the best capacities; for whether they give themselves to goodness or ungraciousness, they do in either excel, as none of the common sort of people can come anything nigh them.
quotes.name: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.message: Nobility is kept alive and strong when it is attached to wealth, and without money it is like a dead thing, for those who are in need have often to turn their hands to vile things.
quotes.name: Martin De Viciana

quotes.message: Nobility without virtue is a fine setting without a gem.
quotes.name: Jane Porter

quotes.message: Nobility is a river that sets with a constant and undeviating current, directly into the great Pacific Ocean of Time; but, unlike all other rivers, it is more grand at its source, than at its termination.
quotes.name: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.message: A degenerate nobleman, or one that is proud of his birth, is like a turnip: there is nothing good of him but that which is underground.
quotes.name: Samuel Butler

quotes.message: If a man be endowed with a generous mind, this is the best kind of nobility.
quotes.name: Plato

quotes.message: Nobility of birth does not always insure a corresponding unity of mind; if it did, it would always act as a stimulus to noble actions; but it sometimes acts as a clog rather than a spur.
quotes.name: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.message: The essence of true nobility is neglect of self.
quotes.name: James A. Froude

quotes.message: Noble blood is an accident of fortune; noble actions characterize the great.
quotes.name: Carlo Goldoni

quotes.message: New nobility is but the act of power, but ancient nobility is the act of time.
quotes.name: Francis Bacon

quotes.message: To do good is noble. To tell others to do good is even nobler and much less trouble.
quotes.name: Mark Twain

quotes.message: The warrior's nobility is like a prostitute's smile, the truth of which is self-interest.
quotes.name: Georges Bataille

quotes.message: Even in adversity, nobility shines through, when a man endures repeated and severe misfortune with patience, not owing to insensibility but from generosity and greatness of soul.
quotes.name: Aristotle

quotes.message: Nobility is expensive, nonproductive, and parasitic, siphoning away too much of societyâ€™s energy to satisfy its frivolous cravings.
quotes.name: Alan Weisman

quotes.message: True nobility is exempt from fear.
quotes.name: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quotes.message: Base men being in love have then a nobility in their natures more than is native to them.
quotes.name: William Shakespeare

quotes.message: My nobility begins in me, but yours ends in you.
quotes.name: Iphicrates

quotes.message: Idleness is an appendix to nobility.
quotes.name: Robert Burton

quotes.message: What is madness but nobility of soul.
quotes.name: Theodore Roethke

quotes.message: I believe that love is better than hate. And that there is more nobility in building a chicken coop than in destroying a cathedral.
quotes.name: Betty Greene

quotes.message: If ancient descent could confer nobility, the lower forms of life would possess it in a greater degree than man.
quotes.name: John Lancaster Spalding

quotes.message: To men and women there falls the task of exploring truth with their reason, and in this their nobility consists.
quotes.name: Pope John Paul II

quotes.message: As one lamp lights another, nor grows less, So nobleness enkindleth nobleness.
quotes.name: James Russell Lowell

quotes.message: Life ought to be a struggle of desire toward adventures whose nobility will fertilize the soul.
quotes.name: Rebecca West

quotes.message: The noble soul has reverence for itself.
quotes.name: Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

quotes.message: Nobleness was one word for making a fuss about the trivial inevitabilities of life, but there were others.
quotes.name: Douglas Adams

quotes.message: Our awesome responsibility to ourselves, to our children, and to the future is to create ourselves in the image of goodness, because the future depends on the nobility of our imaginings.
quotes.name: Barbara Grizzuti Harrison

quotes.message: Many things about our bodies would not seem to us so filthy and obscene if we did not have the idea of nobility in our heads
quotes.name: Georg Lichtenberg

quotes.message: A noble person attracts noble people, and knows how to hold on to them.
quotes.name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.message: If there is anything good about nobility it is that it enforces the necessity of avoiding degeneracy.
quotes.name: Boethius

quotes.message: O lady, nobility is thine, and thy form is the reflection of thy nature!
quotes.name: Euripides

quotes.message: Be noble in every thought And in every deed!
quotes.name: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
